review_blob: Bottle from Gatineau beer store. Pours deep brown with lasting tan head.  Nose of vanilla,  raisin, spice and light caramel.  Taste is overly sweet with candied sugar, notes of dark fruits, spice. Body a bit light for the style. Tart cherry in the finish. Nice Quebec dubbel!

Bottle from Gatineau beer store. Pours deep brown with thick frothy white head. Nose is very smoky. Body quite watery, I was disappointed. Taste of smoky sausage, vanilla, and sweet malt. Finish is bit metallic.

Bottle from Gatineau beer store. Pours  dark brown with thick tan head.  Great nose of roasty malt and rich dark chocolate. Medium body, but a bit too light for my liking. Taste of dark chocolate,  smoke, and oats. Finish a bit metallic. Decent Quebec Imperial.

Bottle from Gatineau beer store. Pours nice amber colour with lasting frothy white head.  Nose of toasty caramel, low grassy hops. Taste of caramel malt, and nuts. Low sweetness with crisp spicy bitter finish. A simple beer, but nice.
Picked up at the brewpub. Pours beep brown with low head. Nose is port and spice. Thick body, taste of caramel malt, pine resin, figs and raisin. Nice smooth finish with mild caramel bitterness.
Picked up at the brewpub. Pours dark brown, tan head. Nose is roasted coffee. Taste is pure espresso, dark chocolate, thick body, bitter finish. Nice beer.
Picked up at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with tan head. Light coffee notes, dark malt, medium body. Taste of sweet chocolate, light roasty coffee, caramel and toffee notes. Decent sweet stout.
Pours black, thick tan head, Nose of medium roast. Medium body, taste of dark chocolate, big roasty coffee. Lingering bitter finish.
Tasted on tap at the brewpub. Pours amber. Taste of decent malt, balanced well with some mild hops. Good IPA, but nothing earth-shattering.
Tasted on tap at the brewpub. Pours deep amber with white head. Spice nose with caramel malt. Taste of rye, big hops, nice caramel malts, a bit nutty. Good beer.

Tasted on tap at the brewpub.  I preferred the original Dirty Bastard to this one. Nose is big on bourbon, coconut. Pours deep amber with low tan head. Taste is overpowering of bourbon, with sweet malt. Finish is long and bitter.

Tasted on tap at the brewpub. Second best beer of the night, only second to Nemesis. Pours back with nice thick tan head.  Nose of smoke and liquorice. Thick body, flavour of roasty malt, liquorice. Finish is bitter and smooth.
Tasted on tap at the brewpub. My favourite beer of the night. Pours dark brown, low tan head. Caramel hop nose. Big caramel hops, taste of molasses, port, caramel and apricot. Great sipper!
Bottle from NYC. Pours dark amber with lasting frothy white head. Amazing oaky, resinous hop and citrus nose.  Taste is  caramel sweetness, a bit of sour, a bit of oak, some ripe fruit. Tasty beer.

Bottle from NYC. Pours dark brown with almost zero head. Nose of scotch, smoke, dark fruit and tobacco. Taste of chocolate, resinous hops. Finish is a bit burning, a little too boozy. Interesting, but not one of the top Stone or Brewdog offerings.

Sampled this one in NYC. Pours black with low white head. Great nose with strong scent of dark roast and liquorice. Body is thick and syrupy with tastes of coffee and dark chocolate and liquorice. Finish is a bit burning.  Not bad, but I was expecting much more.

Tasted up against the Brewdog/Mikkeller collaboration beer I Hardcore You in NYC, and the I Hardcore was the clear winner. Beer pours nice dark amber colour with nice hoppy aroma with pine needles, grapefruits, tropical fruits and toffee and bready notes. Bitter flavour full of complex hops with a bit of sweet caramel malt in the background, some fruits, and a very bitter, piney finish with a bit of resinous notes. Great beer, would like to try it up against the Hardcore IPA 2nd edition.

Tasted up against the Brewdog/Mikkeller collaboration beer I Hardcore You in NYC, and the I Hardcore was the clear winner. Beer pours cloudy light amber colour with nice hoppy aroma with grapefruit and pineapple. Bitter flavour of  hops with a bit of sweet caramel malt in the background, some fruits, and a  long bitter, piney finish with pineapple notes.  Ok beer, but nowhere near as good as the 2nd edition version.

650ml bottle from LCBO. Pours bright amber with minimal white head. Nose is big on nutmeg and pumpkin. Body is relatively thin, but full of more nutmeg , vanilla, bread, and all round pumpkin pie like goodness High alcohol is well hidden. Never a huge fan of this style, but this is an enjoyable beer.

330ml bottle up against the  Ola Dubh 30 & 40. Pours dark brown with beige head. Nose is very roasty. Body is medium with coffee,  liquorice, cherry and soy notes. Finish is bitter and lasting. Nice beer, but much improved in the whisky aged versions.

330mL bottle tasted up against the 40yr and Old Engine Oil. Rates a close second to the wonderful 40. Pours black with small tan head. Nose is amazing scotch notes with rich toffee and smoke. Body is syrupy with tons of dark malts, and toffee. More sweet honey notes compared to the richer 40.
Pours black with lasting tan head. Nose of port, raisin and light coffee. Taste of coffee, bitter dark chocolate with oily body. Quite earthy. Finish is bitter and long.

Bottle from DK. Amazing beer. Nose of bourbon and coffee.  Bourbon not too overpowering in the taste, just a subtle twist on the original weasel. Great rich coffee notes, chocolate malt and vanilla. Finish is slightly warming. One of the top Mikkeller beers!
beer_name: Mikkeller Beer Geek Brunch Weasel (Bourbon Edition)

review_blob: Bottle from Montreal. Really liked this one. Pours dark brown with small amount of off-white head. Nose of maple syrup, wood and caramel malt. Taste of more maple syrup, raisin, toffee and spice. Nice warming finish.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel quinoxe du Printemps

review_blob: Pours cloudy yellow with minimal white head. Light citrus nose. Taste is rather bland, not like other DDC products. Finish has some ok bitterness.

500mL bottle from DK. Pours black with tan head. Amazing nose of oak, smoke with some alcohol coming through. Taste is nice oaky notes, roasty malt, dark chocolate, Akevitt and some spice.  A bit sour character. Finish is smooth and warming.

Thanks Jer for bringing this one back from Africa! Pours amber with low white head. Nose of caramel, spice. Taste of lots of sweet malt, some nuts and honey notes. Nice beer, but finish a bit unpleasant.

750 mL bottle from Boston. Pours hazy dark brown with off-head head. Nose of toffee and dark fruits. Lightly smoky with caramel malts. Notes of raisin, plums, cherries, vanilla and oak.  Not overly sweet, and just a fantastic sipping beer.
Bottle from Boston. Nose is grassy hops. Pours dark brown with low tan head. Flavour of big hit of grassy hops with dark fruit and chocolate malts. Lingering hop finish. A big complex beer.
beer_name: Stone Sublimely Self Righteous Black IPA

review_blob: Bottle from LCBO. Pours black with white head. Nose of pure espresso. Taste is definitely big on espresso, a bit too overpowering on coffee flavours for me. Medium body, very bitter finish.

Bottle from DK. Not a bad beer, but a bit too winey in character for my liking. Pours mahogany with low tan head. Nice aroma of red wind, oak. A bit too overly tart for me. Medium bodied, with clean finish.
beer_name: Nrrebro Imperial Skrgaards Porter Cabernet Barrel

beer_brewer_name: Pretty Things Beer and Ale Project
review_blob: Pours dark-reddish amber with off-white head.  Nose of plums,  dark cherries, figs, and spice.  Nice full body with yeasty notes, and flavours of more plum, raisin and sweet caramel malt. Has bitter lingering finish.
Picked this up in Boston. Pours black with low tan head. Nose is roasty malt. Thick body, with notes of espresso, dark chocolate and mild hop notes. Nice lingering bitter finish. Great beer.

Bottle from LCBO. Pours jet black, oil, thick cream head. Aroma: super milk chocolate, coffee, milk, cream, and spice. Flavour of huge chocolate mouthful, caramel, coffee, cream, spice and nice bitter chocolate finish. Interesting, but way too sickly sweet, almost like chocolate sauce.

Sampled at Brewdog dinner at beerbistro. My favourite brew of the night next to special edition Tokyo Midnight, hopefully they brew that one again. Beer pours nice dark amber colour with nice hoppy aroma with pine needles, grapefruits, tropical fruits and toffee and bready notes. Bitter flavour full of complex hops with a bit of sweet caramel malt in the background, some fruits, and a very bitter, piney finish with a bit of resinous notes. Great beer

Sampled at Brewdog dinner at beerbistro.  Best Paradox I have sampled so far. Pours dark brown with small amount of tan head. Nose is smoke and light peat.  Dark chocolate, smoke, oak and hints of licquorice .  Alcohol does come through, but still more beer than scotch. Nice warming finish.

Brought back from Boston.  I liked this a bit less than the Isle of Arron Paradox, but still very nice. Pours dark brown with small amount of tan head. Nose is smoke and light peat.  Dark chocolate, smoke and hints of molasses .  Alcohol does come through, but still more beer than scotch. Nice warming finish.

Sampled at Brewdog dinner at beerbistro. Pours a beautiful deep ruby with tan frothy head. Lots of caramel malts in the aroma with a citrusy hop smell, taste of caramel malts and bitter hops with a light citrusy and fruity undertone, nice bitter malty finish. A few steps below the hardcore IPA, but nice.

Sampled at Brewdog dinner at beerbistro. In terms of the brewdog crazy strong beers, I liked this one better than the Bismarck. Dark reddish-brown colour with zero head. Aroma is alcohol, coffee, and strong whisky notes. Flavour is smoked malt, coffee, heather, whiskey, alcohol. Alcoholic finish. Intense imperial stout. Like the Bismarck, to be drank like a scotch instead of a beer, but intriguing.

Sampled at Brewdog dinner at beerbistro. Dark golden colour with zero head. Aroma is alcohol, huge hop, pine, citrus. Flavour is alcohol, syrup, hop, pine, citrus. Intense and strong.  Interesting, but not something I could drink more than a few ounces of at a time.

Sampled at Brewdog dinner at beerbistro. Least favourite of the night. Pale yellow, hazy appearance with white, foamy head. Aroma is light citrus, hops, grass and grapefruit. Taste is lightly bitter with orange and honey notes.

500ml bottle from AUS. I had this up against the Armageddon and this was the clear winner for me. Pours amber with lasting white head. Nose of resinous hops, berries and light citrus. Nice caramel malts and medium resinous hops. Nice lasting hop finish. Great beer, from top from NZ so far!

500ml bottle from AUS. I had this up against the Mayhem. Pours dark golden colour with white head. Citrus and mango nose. Taste of grapefruit, bit crisp hop hit upfront and  long bitter finish, a lot like the Rogue yellow snow. Good beer, but not my favourite interpretation of the style though.
Bottle from DK. Pours nice orangey yellow with a white head. Aroma is malty with saaz hop. Flavour is crisp malt, some mild hops.

650ml bottle. Pours black with small amount of beige head. Nose is dark chocolate, coffee, and raisin. Body creamy with notes of dark chocolate, molasses, and some light roasted coffee. Finish is lightly bitter coffee, but lingering. Nice imperial stout!
500ml bottle from LCBO. Pours cloudy amber with small amount of beige head. Lots of honey sweetness to balance the alcohol, nice hoppy finish. I look forward to trying again afer some aging

650ml bottle. Pours pure black with tan head. Nose of huge espresso and dark chocolate, some oak. Thick, creamy body, great roasty espresso flavours, dark chocolate and vanilla. A beautiful coffee beer.
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Espresso Oak Aged

review_blob: 650ml bottle. This is seriously hoppy Imperial Stout! Pours black with minimal tan head. Grassy hop nose with mild coffee. Body is oily with chocolate and lots of hop bite. Long bitter finish.
beer_name: Smuttynose Big Beer Series: Imperial Stout

review_blob: Bottle from Volo. Nice, beer, would like to try it up against the regular Arrogant. Nice copper colour with great aroma of hops and citrus, with some oak. The flavour has nice hoppiness balanced with sweet malts and piney, earthy notes. A nice finish with bit of lingering hops

650 ml bottle from Volo. Nice stout! Pours black with small amount of tan head. Nose of roasty coffee, malt, and a bit of chocolate. Taste of roasted coffee and malt up front followed by a hint of hop bitterness. Smooth finish.
